{"success":true,"issue":{"number":134,"title":"/task crush - batch issue resolution mode","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","origin:agent","feature:new","area:devtools:skills","impact:friction-reduction","friction:repeated-work"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/134","body":"Automate the recurring pattern of:

1. Loading all open issues via `sbs_issue_list`
2. Spawning oracle agent(s) to gather context on each issue
3. Entering alignment with the goal of closing as many issues as possible in one session

Should be invocable as `/task crush` and wire up the pre-alignment context gathering automatically, so the orchestrator enters alignment already informed about the issue landscape.

**Current manual workflow being replaced:**
```
/task Please do the following:
1) Load all of the open issues using the custom mcp tool
2) Deploy an agent tasked with consulting an oracle as many times as it needs to report back to you so you can be properly informed for the following:
3) Start an alignment dialogue. The goal of this task is to close as many open issues as possible.
```

{"success":true,"issue":{"number":95,"title":"Redesign skill execution: orchestrator spawns, agent coordinates, user interacts within agent","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","origin:agent","feature:enhancement","area:devtools:skills","scope:architectural","friction:context-loss"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/95","body":"## Design Principle

All non-atomic skills must run inside a single spawned coordination agent. The orchestrator's only job is assembling context and spawning. All user interaction (alignment, Q&A, confirmations) happens within the agent via AskUserQuestion.

This enables token-efficient multi-skill sessions: 5 tasks + 10 logs + u&a + self-improve in a single orchestrator context.

## Current State

| Skill | Follows Principle? | Gap |
|---|---|---|
| /update-and-archive | **Yes** | None -- only skill that implements this correctly |
| /task | **No** | Claims "center stage" agent model but orchestrator runs phases 1, 2, and 4 directly |
| /self-improve | **No** | Largest gap -- multi-phase workflow, zero delegation |
| /oracle | **No** (atomic) | Policy decision needed |
| /log | **No** (atomic) | Policy decision needed |

## Required Changes

**Non-atomic skills:**
- `/task`: Entire lifecycle (alignment -> planning -> execution -> finalization) runs in one spawned agent
- `/self-improve`: Entire lifecycle (discovery -> selection -> dialogue -> logging -> archive) runs in one spawned agent

**Atomic skill policy decision:**
- Should `/oracle` and `/log` also spawn agents, or are atomic skills exempt?
- Key consideration: `/log` has user interaction (alignment dialogue) making it heavier than a pure query

## Cost Per Skill Invocation (Target)

~700 tokens of orchestrator context (spawn prompt + completion summary), regardless of internal interaction volume.

---
Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

---
